intro: Silene flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid campion, is a flowering plant native to the arctic and alpine regions of the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in harsh conditions. Silene flaccida is often found in tundra and mountain meadow habitats, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these ecosystems.
